article.headline: BYU 74, North Florida 41
article.story: PROVO, Utah -- Jonathan Tavernari had a game-high 25 points in only 24 minutes of play to lead Brigham Young to a 74-41 win over North Florida Thursday night. Tavernari scored BYU's first seven points to lead the Cougars to an early 7-4 lead and then scored another seven straight early in the second half to push the Cougars' lead to 50-24. BYU (3-0) held the Ospreys (0-2) to 12 points on 20 percent shooting in the opening half and held a commanding 23-point lead at the break. The Cougars shot an even 50 percent from the floor for the game but connected on only 4-of-10 from the free-throw line. Lee Cummard had a game-high 12 rebounds for the Cougars, which out-rebounded the Ospreys 45-27. Cameron Lovelace led North Florida with nine points. The game was the first for both teams in a four-team invitational tournament over three days.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
